Kaiapoi home 'absolutely gutted' by suspicious fire MADDISON NORTHCOTT AND JACK FLETCHER Last updated 18:22, February 1 2017 MATTHEW SALMONS/FAIRFAX NZ 
The cause of the blaze is still being investigated. 
A fire that ripped through a Canterbury family's home while they were inside is believed to have been deliberately lit. 
The Kaiapoi family were able to escape the Tuesday night blaze unharmed, thanks largely to a smoke alarm, but their home on the corner of Sneyd St and Cosgrove Rd has been "absolutely gutted". 
Homeowner and resident Hemi Tau said the familyhad spent Wednesday at the house salvaging everything they could. MATTHEW SALMONS/FAIRFAX NZ 
A fire in a home on the corner of Sneyd St and Cosgrove Rd has gutted the Kaiapoi home. 
Fire Service fire risk management officer Kyle Johnston said the blaze was being treated as suspicious and was being investigated by police.

"We have figured out where it started, but because it is under investigation I can't really comment any further." SIMON MAUDE/FAIRFAX NZ 
A Fire Service spokesman says a fire at a Kaiapoi home has highlighted the importance of working smoke alarms. 
A police spokeswoman said it appeared the fire started outside the house. 
The flames ripped through the two-storey home just before midnight on Tuesday, rapidly destroying it. 
Neighbour Amy Morland said her partner was woken by their dog barking and the pair hurried outside. 
"It was very intense. It didn't take long at all before [the house] was fully engulfed in flames. Ad Feedback 
"It's a wood house and within minutes it was absolutely gutted." 
Two adult males, an elderly woman, a young boy and a dog had lived at the property for a couple of years, she said. 
She said the fire was "horrific". 
"Every time I close my eyes I see the house in flames. I can't even imagine what the wee boy is going through. 
"They were all OK, but the boy was upset about his chickens. They didn't make it out." 
Fire Service spokesman Brent Dunn said crews from Kaiapoi and Woodend battled the fire, which took several hours to contain. 
"It was well ablaze when the crews arrived. [The family] had been alerted by the smoke alarms so everyone got out with no injuries", he said. 
He said the house was "badly damaged" by the flames. 
An investigation was under way on Wednesday to determine the cause of the fire. - Stuff
